text: John Edward Caiger (1939-2018), was a male boxer who competed for England. ==Boxing career== He represented England in the -75 Kg division and won a bronze medal at the 1958 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Cardiff, Wales. He was a Light Middleweight ABA champion in 1961. He turned professional under Terry Lawless and later worked as the trainer for Fairburn House Boys Club in Canning Town. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2018 deaths Category:English male boxers Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in boxing Category:Commonwealth Games bronze medallists for England Category:Boxers at the 1958 British Empire and Commonwealth Games Category:Light-middleweight boxers
title: Johnny Caiger
